intro: Ecballium officinale, commonly known as the horse gall or goat's head, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is an annual herb that produces small, green, spiny fruits that turn yellow when mature. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The plant's unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitats.
